sourceMeaningMnemonic:
The <radical>blue</radical> radical and the <kanji>blue</kanji> kanji are exactly the same.

Additionally, this can also mean <kanji>young</kanji>. You can remember this by the <radical>life</radical> radical inside of <radical>blue</radical> symbolizing the birth and growth of something new, and therefore young.
meaningInfo: Don't feel blue, you should know this kanji automagically!
readingMnemonic: You've been feeling really <kanji>blue</kanji>. Mostly because your skin, hair, and eyes have all turned blue. The <reading>Shou</reading>gun (<ja>しょう</ja>) found out and now he's back. He places his hand on your shoulder and then points at your <reading>sa</reading>ber (<ja>せい</ja>). It's blue too! You aren't alone!
readingInfo: You aren't sure how you or the saber turned blue, but you're pretty sure the Shougun had something to do with it. At least you match now, I guess.
